body:
Hey @dr-js! We really appreciate you taking the time to report an issue. The collaborators
on this project attempt to help as many people as possible, but we're a limited number of volunteers,
so it's possible this won't be addressed swiftly.

If you need any help, or just have general Babel or JavaScript questions, we have a vibrant Slack
community that typically always has someone willing to help. You can sign-up [here](https://slack.babeljs.io/)
for an invite.

rename.from: [plugin-proposal-object-rest-spread] TypeError: Property value of ObjectProperty expected node to be of a type
rename.to: [Babel 7][plugin-proposal-object-rest-spread] TypeError: Property value of ObjectProperty expected node to be of a type

body:
Thanks for the report, seems like my fault - my latest PR doesn't cover all cases appropriately. Gonna work on fixing this.

For now you can use default mode of the transform (non-loose).

body: Has this been looked into yet?

issue.title: [core] Upgrade to babel@rc.1

repository.name: material-ui
repository.description: Material UI: Comprehensive React component library that implements Google's Material Design. Free forever.

issue.body:
- Upgrade Babel to the release candidate üéâ . Babel has quite **some bugs**. But I was able to get work around them, it was hard.
  - Use `babel.config.js` as `.babelrc.js` extends seems to be broken with the `babel-plugin-module-resolver` module. https://github.com/babel/babel/pull/7358
  - Disable the loose mode with the es mode. https://github.com/babel/babel/issues/8323
  - Remove flow. There is an issue with Babel that prevents us from moving forward with the flow syntax. Flow hasn't been of any help for us the last 6 months, mainly because we didn't invest in it. Let's assume our position by removing it. https://github.com/babel/babel/issues/8157
  - An obscure bug with the ignore option of the CLI, it doesn't work, we have to force `ignore: ['**/*.test.js'],` in the config. https://github.com/babel/babel/issues/8224
- Upgrade Next.js with https://github.com/zeit/next.js/pull/4766.
- For some reason I can't explain, the `@material-ui/core` package is 6% smaller:
```diff
    name: 'The size of all the modules of material-ui.',
    webpack: true,
    path: 'packages/material-ui/build/index.js',
-   limit: '95.6 KB',
+   limit: '89.4 KB',
  },
``

issue.body:
<!--
Before making a PR, please read our contributing guidelines
https://github.com/babel/babel/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

For issue references: Add a comma-separated list of a [closing word](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) followed by the ticket number fixed by the PR. (it should be underlined in the preview if done correctly)

If you are making a change that should have a docs update: submit another PR to https://github.com/babel/website
-->

| Q ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†  | A <!--(Can use an emoji üëç) -->
| ------------------------ | ---
| Fixed Issues?            | fixes #8323
| Patch: Bug Fix?          | yes
| Major: Breaking Change?  |
| Minor: New Feature?      |
| Tests Added + Pass?      | Yes
| Documentation PR Link    | <!-- If only readme change, add `[skip ci]` to your commits -->
| Any Dependency Changes?  |
| License                  | MIT

<!-- Describe your changes below in as much detail as possible -->
